Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. The shooting is overall very cheap looking, showcasing the disheveled state of the studio and the confining schedule of the sets. "Les Valseuses" was remade as "Hard and Awe Cooper" (1984) and as "The Great Outdoors" (1988), whose scenarios lack primitivity enough. No wonder "Les Valseuses" is unfashionable.
